thread.title: General Election: How the North East voted last time - and where June's battles will be fiercest
thread.title_full: General Election: How the North East voted last time - and where June's battles will be fiercest

author: Jonathan Walker
title: General Election: How the North East voted last time - and where June's battles will be fiercest
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The race for Number 10 is underway. 
Theresa May has called a General Election for June 8. 
The Prime Minister said she believed she needs a stronger mandate ahead of the country’s Brexit negotiations. 
The election will be strongly contested in the North East - which could see the area’s political map redrawn again. Here’s how the seats are currently held - and what could happen next. Berwick-upon-Tweed Conservative MP for Berwick Anne-Marie Trevelyan 
Current MP: Anne-Marie Trevelyan - Conservative (majority 4,914) 
This Northumberland seat we held by the Liberal Democrats for decades. At the last election, the Lib Dems were hit by the loss of well-known local MP Alan Beith, who retired and went to the House of Lords, and the collapse in the party’s vote following five years in coalition government with the Conservatives. 
The Lib Dems will hope to win Berwick back in June, and it’s probably their best hope in the North East. But sitting Conservative MP Anne-Marie Trevelyan has developed a high profile as an outspoken and independent-minded MP. 
She’s a staunch Brexiteer, so it will be interesting to see whether voters in this beautiful and historic constituency back her or the pro-EU Lib Dems. Bishop Auckland Labour candidate Helen Goodman (Photo: Mirrorpix) 
Current MP: Helen Goodman - Labour (majority 3,508) 
Conservatives came a close second in this County Durham seat in 2015, and it should be one of the region’s key battlegrounds this time around. If the polls are right then Theresa May’s party could have a chance of winning, providing a boost to their claim to be a party for the whole country including the north of England. 
Helen Goodman has been the MP since 2005. She was a Minister in the last Labour government, led by Gordon Brown, and a shadow minister in opposition under Ed Miliband. Blaydon Dave Anderson 
Current MP: Dave Anderson - Labour (majority 14,227) 
Labour is defending a solid majority in this Tyne and Wear seat. UKIP came second here last time, just ahead of the third-place Tories. 
MP Dave Anderson, a former president of trade union UNISON, is on the left of the party. He’s been steadfastly loyal to Jeremy Corbyn since Mr Corbyn became leader, and currently serves as Shadow Northern Ireland Secretary and Shadow Scottish Secretary in Labour’s shadow cabinet. Blyth Valley Blyth MP Ronnie Campbell (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) 
Current MP: Ronnie Campbell - Labour (majority 9,229) 
Another seat where UKIP came second in 2015, and the Conservatives were just behind in third place. 
Ronnie Campbell, a former miner and NUM official, has been the MP since 1987. He planned to retire if the election took place in 2020, as previously expected, but has announced he will stand again in the early election on June 8 this year. 
He’s on the left and has been pretty blunt in his criticism of Labour MPs who refuse to support Jeremy Corbyn, City of Durham Cllr Roberta Blackman-Woods 
Current MP: Roberta Blackman-Woods - Labour (majority 11,439) 
Conservatives are in second place here, but a long way behind Labour . Defending MP Roberta Blackman-Woods is a shadow housing minister. although she was one of a number of shadow ministers to resign in 2016, saying she had no confidence in the party leader, and return to a front bench role after Mr Corbyn won a second leadership campaign. Easington Labour MP for Easington Grahame Morris 
Current MP: Grahame Morris - Labour (majority 14,641) 
This County Durham seat is a Labour stronghold. UKIP came second here in 2015. 
MP Grahame Morris, a left-winger, was shadow local government secretary in Mr Corbyn’s top team. He has left this role after suffering ill health but his office confirmed he would stand as Labour’s candidate in June’s election. Gateshead 
Current MP: Ian Mearns - Labour (majority 14,784) 
Gateshead is another safe Labour seat. UKIP were second here in 2015. 
Sitting MP Ian Mearns has campaigned against cuts to council funding, which has hit services such as social care. 
He has an important role at Westminster as chair of the Commons Backbench Business Committee, which helps decide what gets debated in Parliament. Hexham Guy Opperman 
Current MP: Guy Opperman - Conservative (majority 12,031) 
This Northumberland seat is the safest Conservative seat in the North East. Sitting MP Guy Opperman , a former barrister and amateur jockey, is a Tory moderate with a key government role as a whip. Houghton and Sunderland South Wearside MP Bridget Phillipson 
Current MP: Bridget Phillipson - Labour (majority 12,938) 
Bridget Phillipson has been the MP here since 2010. She is a member of the Commons Public Accounts Committee, which scrutinises spending, and a former opposition whip. 
UKIP came second here in 2015. Jarrow Stephen Hepburn MP 
Current MP: Stephen Hepburn - Labour (majority 13,881) 
This Tyne and Wear seat should be safe for Labour. UKIP came second here in 2015. 
MP Stephen Hepburn is a former Deputy Leader of South Tyneside Borough Council Newcastle upon Tyne Central Newcastle Central MP Chi Onwurah 
Current MP: Chi Onwurah - Labour (majority 12,673) 
MP Chi Onwurah is a shadow business minister, and kept this role despite rebelling against the Labour whip and voting against triggering Article 50 in the House of Commons. She argued that she was not opposed to allowing Brexit to go ahead, following last year’s referendum, but said Conservative Prime Minister Theresa May had failed to provide assurances that the North East economy would be protected. 
She’s an engineer who is an expert on issues relating to the internet and technology. 
Conservatives came second in this seat in 2015. Newcastle upon Tyne East Newcastle East MP Nick Brown 
Current MP: Nick Brown - Labour (majority 12,494) 
Nick Brown has a distinguished career, serving three times as Labour’s chief whip and as Minister for the North East, among other senior roles. 
He was a close ally of former Prime Minister Gordon Brown and comes from a different Labour Party tradition to party leader Jeremy Corbyn. 
However, he agreed to take on the difficult task of Shadow Chief Whip at Mr Corbyn’s request in 2016, taking responsibility for discipline among Labour MPs, and this is the post he holds today. 
There had been reports that Mr Brown planned to retire at the 2020 general election but he could choose to stand again in the early election in June this year. Newcastle upon Tyne North Catherine McKinnell (Photo: Newcastle Chronicle) 
Current MP: Catherine McKinnell - Labour (majority 10,153) 
Catherine McKinnell has been an MP since 2010. She was something of a rising star, as a shadow Treasury minister under Labour leader Ed Miliband and Shadow Attorney General under Jeremy Corbyn’s leadership, a post that gave her a seat in the Shadow Cabinet. 
However, she quit this role in 2016, citing the pressure of being a mum to young children and a desire to speak out more on issues affecting her constituency. North Durham Kevan Jones (Photo: Stefan Rousseau/PA Wire) 
Current MP: Kevan Jones - Labour (majority 13,644) 
Local MP Kevan Jones was a defence minister in the last Labour government and served as shadow minister for the armed forces when Labour went into opposition. 
He has clashed with Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn over nuclear weapons, arguing that the UK must maintain a credible nuclear deterrent, while working to advance global nuclear disarmament, 
Mr Jones is also a campaigner for better mental health services. North Tyneside 
Current MP: Mary Glindon - Labour (majority 17,194) 
Sitting MP Mary Glindon, a former North Tyneside councillor , is a shadow environment minister. 
Liberal Democrats came second in North Tyneside in 2010, falling to fourth place behind Labour, the Conservatives and UKIP in 2015. North West Durham Pat Glass MP (Photo: Ian Forsyth/Getty Images) 
Current MP: Pat Glass - Labour (majority 10,056) 
Pat Glass is to stand down at this election, so North West Durham will be getting a new MP however constituents vote. Read More General Election 2017: Could Labour lose North East seats to the Tories? 
She is a former Shadow Europe Minister who briefly served as Shadow Education Secretary. Mrs Glass was also one of the leaders of Labour’s official “remain” campaign in the 2016 referendum. 
North West Durham is likely to be a safe Labour seat. Liberal Democrats came second here in 2005 and 2010, but Conservatives were second in 2015. South Shields South Shields MP Emma Lewell-Buck 
Current MP: Emma Lewell-Buck - Labour (majority 10,614) 
Emma Lewell-Buck won this Tyne and Wear seat in a 2013 by-election after former MP David Miliband chose to leave the House of Commons. 
She is currently a shadow education minister. 
UKIP came second here in 2010. Sunderland Central Julie Elliott, Labour MP for Sunderland Central 
Current MP: Julie Elliott - Labour (majority 11,179) 
Julie Elliott is a former shadow energy minister. She has campaigned against zero hour contracts and the closure of Sunderland Central Fire Station. Tynemouth Tynemouth MP Alan Campbell 
Current MP: Alan Campbell - Labour (majority 8,240) 
Alan Campbell has been Labour’s deputy chief whip since 2010, which means he served under both former leader Ed Miliband and Jeremy Corbyn. He was a Home Office Minister when Gordon Brown was Prime Minister. Wansbeck Wansbeck MP Ian Lavery (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Current MP: Ian Lavery - Labour (majority 10,881) 
Ian Lavery, the sitting MP in this Northumberland seat, is a former President of miners’ union the NUM. 
He’s the Shadow Minister for the Cabinet Office, which means he has a place in Jeremy Corbyn’s Shadow Cabinet, but perhaps even more significant is his role as Labour’s national elections and campaign co-ordinator. 
Mr Lavery is on the left of the party and has been a staunch supporter of Mr Corbyn. 
Liberal Democrats came second in Wansbeck in elections from 1997 to 2010, but Conservatives were in second place here in 2015. Washington and Sunderland West Sharon Hodgson (Photo: 2011 Getty Images) 
Current MP: Sharon Hodgson - Labour (majority 13,157) 
Sharon Hodgson, a shadow public health minister, has campaigned in favour of free school meals and for action to stop ticket touts. 
UKIP came second in this seat in 2015. Like us on Facebook
